intro: Sunaptea brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are short and woody. Sunaptea brevipes is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
